intro: Diplocaulobium fariniferum, commonly known as the farina-bearing diplocaulobium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with a fine, powdery coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
